website_summaries.verdict: A new wristband and new firmware improve the Pulse and make it a true fitness band, but it's not a big leap forward over last year.
pros: Excellent pedometer, excellent app, affordably priced
cons: Can’t read your heart rate with the band on
screen is not always on, and terrible in bright daylight

website_summaries.verdict: The Withings Pulse takes everything you love about existing top-notch activity trackers and adds a nifty built-in heart rate sensor, giving you a more comprehensive picture of your overall health.
pros: Records steps, distance, feet climbed, heart rate, and more
Can display last 14 days' worth of information

customer_reviews.title: To me rubbish
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as am COPD sufferer and have been told by specialist nurse told it would be ideal to track my oxegen saturation and pulse rate whilst sleeping. This from description seamed ideal but no i have yet to get a spo2 reading and the programs seam to always want to count the number steps and does so, i am wheelchair bound and the blood pressure has not moved from 120/80 I suffer from hypertension and bp is always high until medicated in morning So this item has yet to perform as described and certainly has yet to perform as was hoped for So a useless purchase and am highly disappointed
customer_reviews.author: steve russel

customer_reviews.title: Little more than a gimmick
customer_reviews.text: Having had this for around 2 weeks I can only say it is little more than a gimmick. I was looking forward to tracking my activity across walks, runs and football, but it cannot differentiate between the three. According to the Pulse Ox, I burn the same calories regardless of the intensity of the exercise, for example a 1 hour session, playing 5 a side football burns only 150 calories!! I cannot recommend this product for anything other than walking and for that you can get a free app on your phone!!
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great product for keeping track of pulse
customer_reviews.text: Great product for keeping track of pulse, weight , blood pressure etc but unfortunately the wrist band holder is useless and within two weeks of purchasing the unit it fell out and I lost it. Have bought another as I like the unit but this time I will sellotape it in which shouldn't be necessary and will look awful, please redesign the holder so that it cannot slip out so easily as this will be a on going issue. Update , second one arrived but then developed a fault which they replaced foc but that one also developed a fault and i am now waiting for Withings to replace it as well. Maybe not as good as i first thought
customer_reviews.author: Alfie1960

customer_reviews.title: Not all its cracked up to be!
customer_reviews.text: If you believe the hype it's all singing all dancing. Well so far it works over Bluetooth but I repeatedly followed the step by step set up & each time it got to the WiFi bit the app crashed! No response from customer services at all on how to resolve! It would have had 1 star but for the fact that it does work over Bluetooth saving it from that!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: SpO2 not really worth having.
customer_reviews.text: Basically OK. The SpO2/Ox isn't really worth having because your reading will be one of 97%, 98%, 99% unless you are dead i.e. the range and precision is so small as to be meaningless. This isn't a fault of the equipment - It's just how we are.
customer_reviews.author: Nick H

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this off the warehouse as it was about ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this off the warehouse as it was about £30 cheaper used. On arrival it had no micro USB cable which wasn't an issue i have have a few. The other problem was that it would not activate sleep mode. I contacted Withings as their products have 2 year warranty and they asked me to send it to them as it had a hardware issue and they are sending me a brand new replacement worth £79.99!!
customer_reviews.author: dawn

customer_reviews.title: Not very good!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty useless piece of kit to be honest. The battery life is appalling. How can you possibly wear this all day and then night, when the battery doesn't last? In fact, a lot of the time, after recharging it, I can't even turn the damned thing on. Fair to say, not that impressed. Just to add to that. After about a year, it stopped working altogether. Simply will not charge. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Dominic Raywood

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor, easy to use, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Love the tracking system, seems accurate enough and really helpful for sleeping patterns, heart rate, steps, calories and distance. Simple to use and integrates with other gadgets if you want to invest on them as well. I'm looking forward to scale and blood pressure monitor as soon as I have budget for it :) The other advantage is the app that comes with it, you can add calories consumed and weight fluctuations using the app or other apps that integrate with it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Sleep tracker works but catches when I go to bed not actually sleeping. App on my phone works better. USB connection and phone app are useless. Takes several attempts to connect, until eventually it wouldn't. Put it in the bin.
customer_reviews.author: A Miney

customer_reviews.title: Good product but prone to loss
customer_reviews.text: Good for price for tracking exercise and software simple but useful. Only issue is that this is 3rd item. Lost 2 before because belt fitting is not robust enough. Now only wear on wrist. Not waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: BernD

customer_reviews.title: owing to the fact it didn’t like the temperature of 30
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I can not give you a fair review on this item, owing to the fact it didn’t like the temperature of 30 !!! Mind you it didn’t appreciate being left in trouser pocket, while said trouser went in the washing machine either! Sadly I haven’t got the cash to replace it at the present time, maybe one day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective, returned.
customer_reviews.text: Returned defective. 3rd Withings item bought that was defective and returned.
customer_reviews.author: cautious scheptic

customer_reviews.title: Very poor.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing. I expected continuous heart rate output, but all you get is single moment readings which you can't get when you are actually active, you have to stop and go through a fiddly process to get it. It seems quite unaware when I'm exerting myself cycling, I rode just over 60 miles and it told me I'd taken just over 100 steps!! It expects 8 hours sleep, I'm 67 and never needed more than 6 hours since I was 16, but you can't change it. I feel as if I've wasted £70 which I could have put towards something decent like a Fitbit Surge.
customer_reviews.author: R J WALKER

customer_reviews.title: Syncing issues
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to sync the tracker with the phone since the time I bought this tracker. I have also contacted the Withings Customer service about this issue and it is still not solved. As a customer, I feel that I have been let down as I am not able to access all the features of the tracker.
customer_reviews.author: Anoo

customer_reviews.title: I love this device & all the things it can do
customer_reviews.text: I love this device & all the things it can do! Had a bit of trouble at first as the one I received was defective. Contacted Withings directly for technical support, hoping it could just be reset or something. That didn't work however, though Withings immediately sent me a new replacement. No mess, no fuss and it works perfectly. Happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: CDJ

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted, but chronically unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Good while it lasts. I have been using the Pulse, in various forms, over the last three years. I am now on my third (purchased one replacement, Withings replaced another three), but the latest one has now died and I am going to look for other options. Functionally it's not bad, but none of these devices are precision instruments so really all you want is reliability, the ability to function in active environments, and then the lowest price. On that basis, I will not be going back to Withings.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B

customer_reviews.title: Buy if you use Apple devices, don't bother with Android!
customer_reviews.text: The pulse is great but only works properly with the Apple app. We could not make the Android work even following the steps suggested by customer services. A major flaw although my original pulse from before Nokia took over worked fine
customer_reviews.author: K A Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great looking, solid
customer_reviews.text: Great looking, solid. There is just one issue that needs patience .... Quick start manual is as good as useless, you need some bluetooth knowledge, online info needs a good search around to figure out what's what! I can see some additional 'goodies' coming for this product soon. At first I was reaching for the hammer, now I just love it
customer_reviews.author: Ray B.

customer_reviews.title: along with the Withings scales they provide very good sources of data collection
customer_reviews.text: It works (a number I have tried don't when you are working and walking back and forward to the same point, such as moving loads from one place to another in a wheel barrow), simple to use and is accurate, not keen on the sleep function as you have to manually set it which means you have to remember to set it before you fall asleep. It works seamlessly with the Withings App, along with the Withings scales they provide very good sources of data collection.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon MacDougall

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and afford.
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy. I find it no better than a £10 pedometer. It really lacks and useful features. You have to manually do everything. You can't just put it on and forget. Also the pictures are misleading it shows you wearing on your wrist the first they tell you is don't wear it on your wrist. It is very inaccurate and not worth if you do. Also it does fall out of it belt clip all the time.
customer_reviews.author: JAG

customer_reviews.title: It's OK but some of the features have to be ...
customer_reviews.text: It's OK but some of the features have to be initiated manually which means if you forget to set the sleep mode you won't get sleep analysis. The set up was problematic but got there in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to navigate with side button
customer_reviews.text: Not comfortable to wear and not easy to navigate with the side button. Also had an issue with the button which kept blocking and prevented the steps from being counted
customer_reviews.author: Meli_Melo

customer_reviews.title: Features not working
customer_reviews.text: Received it promptly but the pulse and oxygen part of the monitor aren't working. Have contacted Withings help support team 2 days ago and heard nothing since. other than that I like the fact that you can see steps done at a button press. Probably should have gone for the up24
customer_reviews.author: Katerina

customer_reviews.title: Fab!
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this because I had it as a present for Christmas myself and I think that everyone should have one. I have always been an active person but since I had this I rialise I much more active than I though I was!! I have used it to monitor my sleep as well because I dont sleep well at night..
customer_reviews.author: EFH

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I was bought this as a present and found it found it very useful. I am neither youg nor an athelete - but have achieved a notable imrpovement in my activity levels and weight since using the Pulse. I like the grahical presentation on the app and the encouragement this provides. After 5 weeks it developed a minor fault, but Withings replaced it graciously and quickly - and free of charge. I would recommend the product and their customer service most enthusiastically.
customer_reviews.author: Paulukabe

customer_reviews.title: Could not connect and sync
customer_reviews.text: Used too much time to just set it up. Even performed a factory reset, but it never got to work and had to send it back. Sadly cannot recommend this piece of electronic. Maybe I just got a bad one.
customer_reviews.author: diness

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. I bought this so I did not have to carry my phone all the time. The steps don't match. Most times the Withings has a much lower step count.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Good things: It's light It's comfortable Activity is recorded ...
customer_reviews.text: Good things: It's light It's comfortable Activity is recorded by steps so treadmill activity is recorded Bad things: Display is slightly blurred Heart rate and pulse ox readings dubious
customer_reviews.author: AnorakPanda

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: A good product if your committed, mines now in the drawer. So it's an expensive whim. Does what it says it will do
customer_reviews.author: Jan Giles

customer_reviews.title: Faulty straight out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as it was the best suited to what I was looking for, it set up ok, and the heart rate monitor works, but it doesn't pick up any steps unless you violently shake it around. Returning for refund, and buying a Fitbit one instead.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B

customer_reviews.title: got bored with this and gave up on it as for ...
customer_reviews.text: got bored with this and gave up on it as for the O2 meter it's not reliable and you become obsessed with your oxygen saturation levels which in my health situation could cause panic so there just not worth knowing about. If it's just for running or exercise then it is a good product and gives you good readings
customer_reviews.author: mike spence

customer_reviews.title: Gr8t device
customer_reviews.text: Since I've become the owner of the pulse through a present its been a really really positive addition to my life and general fitness, makes it so easy to be aware of your daily movements and what you need to do to reach a target, on top of this, the general service and help from the withings team has been unreal. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Emma Watters

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed with this product overall
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with this product overall. First of all, it has said that I've walked 127 steps for the last hour, even though I have been doing a workout. But I am also very upset with the app that comes with this product. The app and the tracker communicate with each other, as evidence by the fact that the app "sees" my heart rate measurements. However, it consistently says I have taken NO steps, burned NO calories, etc. And since I had bought this product specifically for its ability to sync with MyFitnessPal, I am particularly disappointed because if the app doesn't sync to the device, the activity doesn't get counted by the MyFitnessPal app either.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ashley

customer_reviews.title: dont use the belt clip
customer_reviews.text: I wish someone had told me to avoid the belt clip coz i've already lost it :( Not perfect but the best i could find Pros: Worked (mostly) as advertised Great battery life (over a week per charge) Compact (easy to lose) Cons: Can't use it as a watch coz screen goes dark & defaults to the step screen (so u need 2 watches) Silicone belt clip is not secure, it falls out if you bump up against something Does not continuously monitor heart rate (have to take it off) so you cant track heart rate etc during your workout
customer_reviews.author: Hilton Madevu-Matson

customer_reviews.title: Nice little fitness tracker with some extras
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to replace a Fitbit One. My wife had been using the One for several years and wore it out. The Pulse O2 was an excellent product for the sale price. Screen can be difficult to read at times. PulseOx feature is interesting and seems to be accurate. Battery life is above average. Only negative is I don't think the step count is very accurate. There is a significant difference between the Fitbit, Google Fit and the Pulse O2. The watch and clip allow good flexibility. The Nokia app is also pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. D. R.

customer_reviews.title: Recurring Hardware Issues
customer_reviews.text: This product is mediocre. The heart rate monitor function is okay, not great, but okay. You'll get readings that vary by up to 10bpms depending on what location you use. It is very fragile though, as others have said. My pulse just broke for the 3rd time (hardware issue all 3 times) and considering it is now a couple months outside of the 1 year warranty period, I have no more coverage for it. Therefore, I was offered 25% off a replacement, but considering this is my 3rd unit and they all had the same issue, it's not worth the $$. I'm rather pay just a little bit more and try the Fitbit HR instead.
customer_reviews.author: A.

customer_reviews.title: Unit failed after 8 days.
customer_reviews.text: So, I got my new Pulse O2 on August 10. On August 18 it failed with "error 7." The manufacturer tells me that this error code "indicates a hardware failure and the unit will require replacement." I asked whether the replacement would be refurbished or factory new. So far, no response. Not surprisingly, I'm not ok with a refurbished unit when mine fails after 8 days. Frankly, I'm not sure I even want another one. If this is Withing's quality control, then I'm not confident in my purchase. I may update this review in the future depending on whether it is promptly replaces and, if so, how it performs afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: S.F.

customer_reviews.title: I am pleased with my choice and purchase
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a way to keep track of your steps and activity reliably as well as monitor your sleep and heart rate, the Withings Pulse fits the bill. I am able to sync with two of my android devices that have updated firmware and go to the website to view analysis of my activity, sleep and heart rate. It does what is intended and what I was looking for. I have had a couple of issues to correct, and the customer service was top-notch. I received quick replies and detailed explanations, so I have no complaints. I am pleased with my choice and purchase.
customer_reviews.author: James Clark

customer_reviews.title: After 3 different fitness trackers, we found our favorite with the Withings Pulse O2
customer_reviews.text: Having used a FitBit Flex, FitBit Force, and now a Withings Pulse O2, the Pulse O2 is by far the best fitness tracker my wife and I have used. Tracking hourly activity, heart rate, blood oxygenation (SpO2), sleep monitoring, and daily travels (distances and altimeter), it provides an incredible amount of information into our lives. Combined with the Withings Scale, we also see our heart rate, weight, and indoor air quality as part of our daily metrics. We have been incredibly pleased with the Withings Pulse O2 and we'd recommend it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria, Ken, Kiyomi & Toshiro Foreman

customer_reviews.title: A great device integrated within the Withings family of products
customer_reviews.text: A great device integrated within the Withings family of products. It does a great job as a pedometer and records elevation changes so you can see how many flights of stairs you have climbed throughout the day and records sleep patterns, heart rate and blood oxygen levels. It packs a lot into this tiny device and being tiny, you may want to purchase a lanyard as well to keep from loosing this little item if you choose to use the pocket clip. I would have given the Pulse 5 stars except that my first one only lasted about a week before it failed. Withings support, however, is quite thorough and replaced it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this item because I like the discreteness of the clip vs
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine has this device and it works really well for them. I ordered this item because I like the discreteness of the clip vs. wrist band. The first Pulse O2 I ordered, would only sporadically come on. I could never get it to pair with my Samsung S6. It also intermittently displayed "error 7". So, I decided to replace it - same device. The replacement Pulse O2 wouldn't even turn on...and, yes, I did charge it. Nothing. Zero. Zilch. Time and effort wasted. I will say, however, a huge thank you to Amazon for being so easy to return items to. That is the only positive feedback I have about this item.
customer_reviews.author: Suz

customer_reviews.title: Customer Support Much Improved and Now Satisfactory
customer_reviews.text: Withings customer support, which used to be ghastly, has vastly improved and is now reasonably good. They don't have telephone support, but their email support is satisfactory. I have some trouble with the pulse breaking down (two have broken down to date), but it doesn't matter all that much as they have replaced them promptly, I also own their scale and blood pressure monitor. Both work OK, except I had considerable trouble six months getting the scale to sync with their server, a problem that was vastly compounded by what was then very poor and very delayed responses.
customer_reviews.author: Roger R. Conant

customer_reviews.title: do yourself a favor and buy a different fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy one of these. Get a different tracker. I bought mine in late September 2014. By the second week in October the touch screen functions had stopped working rendering sleep, heart and O2 tracking wireless. Contacted Withings and they sent me a replacement in mid- October. Now it is mid-November and the touch/swipe functions have again stopped working. Withings will not give me a refund because I bought it on Amazon. Amazon won't give me a refund because I bought it more than 30 days ago. Just a big disappointment all around. I will be purchasing a fitbit instead.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this device - doesn't reliably pair with all Android devices and Withings has zero customer support available
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to the functionality of this device - going beyond the usual fitness tracker that I've used in the past. Unfortunately it will not pair with my Android phone at all - and my phone is only a few months old so there is no issue on the Android software side. Trying to find support from Withings is an exercise in futility as the company apparently doesn't know how to support its products. I would advise anyone to avoid this product completely. Withings needs to learn to write software and how to support consumer devices. I would give this device less than 1 star if that were an option - a frustrating waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Biz

customer_reviews.title: Poor Customer Support sent us racing back to Fitbut
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my husband to replace the Fitbit One he lost. He is going back to a Fitbit. The customer service was abysmal, no on-line help, no manual, nothing. It didn't work. We ran a 5K and this device said he did a 150 steps and 3 calories while my Fitbit Zip had me at about 8,000 steps and 400 calories. Customer service explained that their device would measure differently than the FitBit - well, yeah, but we expected it to be at least somewhat accurate. Since they refused to provide any help at all, this was returned.
customer_reviews.author: Elise Moss

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: This is not the First a Tivit y tracker that i o en so is easy to say it is ridiculous. You want to track your sleep so you hace to let the device know you are going to sleep. Want to track your heart rate well you have to move the watch to your finger. I think this is a very very old device.
customer_reviews.author: julio.salcedo

customer_reviews.title: Too good to be true, not a usable watch.
customer_reviews.text: Don't Buy if you want to wear as a watch. After having no problem with this for 30 days, this magically fell out of teh watch holder because there is nothing actually holding it in place so after a few times in and out of the holder (which you need to do for pulse/o2 rates) , it can randomly fall out. I did change this to 3 stars as they were very quick and sent me a replacement however, I still advice tape or a band to hold this on and to be very very careful about wearing it without checking especially somewhere you'll never find it (mine fell off during my commute on DC metro)
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha C. Corp

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the crazy price tag
customer_reviews.text: it's not exactly what I expected, but it still works just as much as I need it to and does what I need. I highly recommend getting one of the newer Activity fitness trackers that go everything this one can and a ton more. If you have a Samsung Galaxy S6, as my mom does then don't bother wasting your money on it, as it will NOT pair with those devices.
customer_reviews.author: Biggdubbya

customer_reviews.title: It works well in certain features but unfortunately the most important feature of mileage is not accurate enough to make it tota
customer_reviews.text: The Pulse O2 is a well designed unit. It works well in certain features but unfortunately the most important feature of mileage is not accurate enough to make it totally a great product. I am hoping that the designers will change the way the unit calculates distance and allow step length in put for both walking and running. This would make this unit an incredible buy for the price. I really like the syncing ability with other program, the sleep tracking and heart O2 monitoring which it does very well. It is also a very comfortable unit to wear and the unit convertibility from watch to belt clip is well thought out.
customer_reviews.author: Josef Pfister

customer_reviews.title: Was great for the first 4 months
customer_reviews.text: i purchased this as a Christmas gift for my 77 year old mother who wanted an activity tracker and it was simple for her to use. It was fantastic for the first 4 months. Last month, the touch screen wouldn't work anymore so I helped her fix it by powering it off and back on. Today, the same thing happened, but it won't power back on. It's done this twice now with not powering even while plugged into a power source. I am pretty disappointed since this wasn't a cheap device. Should have gone with a Fitbit instead. I now have to deal with customer support and wonder if it'll get replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great device, but questionable sleep monitor.
customer_reviews.text: I have had some time to use this device and I do like it. It's Easy to use. The steps taken, miles walked, calories burned and heart rate seem to be accurate and real close to my Apps I use on my phone which track by GPS. The device is easy to sync and Withings App is easy to use. Now my only concern about the device is the sleep monitor. The sleep monitor seems to get it right when I'm in a deep sleep. However, when it records light sleeping, I'm usually awake. It also states I fall asleep in 7 to 10 minutes. Not true. I like the device, but question the sleep monitor accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Road1

customer_reviews.title: Self - centered software.
customer_reviews.text: What a disappointment. This is designed around typical self - centered software that assumes thus is the primary, one and only piece of software needed to fulfill your health needs. It assumes that any other health related app must feed to it instead of it integrating with apps that may be counting caloric intake, I.e. similar to Map My Fitness. If you use nothing else for anything else for overall health related status or progress, and by now who still thinks a single silver bullet will reveal all your health criteria, then this may suit your needs. Gave mine to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Coffeen

customer_reviews.title: Good product and features but needs some refinement
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well and the pulse and oxygen level measure function is really nice. Only real downside to that is, you have to take it out of the wrist-band since the sensor is on the bottom. "Real time tracking:" - since it doesn't monitor the pulse rate, it's hard to use it for workouts where I'd like to stay in my "zone". The sleep tracker is sometimes off key - shows no light sleep or wake phases at all. Android app is good and it recognized all activities so far. Compared to Sony SWR10 and ifit it seemed to be more accurate by measuring distances and steps. Battery time is about 12 days when used daily.
customer_reviews.author: McZaustria

customer_reviews.title: This is very nice little step tracker
customer_reviews.text: This is very nice little step tracker. I wear it all the time now and it encourages me to walk more often and to get more sleep. The only problem I have had with it is that the band caused a rash. I resolved this issue by crocheting myself little ankles bracelets to hold it n various colors to match my outfits. I have sever arthritis in both knees so I cannot walk a lot. I walk frequently but not far. So to increase my exercise without straining my knees, I use an under-the-desk elliptical. With Withings (say that three times really fast without spitting :) ) on my ankle so the tracker can pick up the movement.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Withing Technical Support
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best health items I have ever purchased. It works in conjunction with my iPhone 6. It tracks all aspects of my health, e.g.: number of steps take, pulse/Ox, sleep patterns (love this feature), and more. Their customer service is great. I originally pair the Pulse to an iPhone 5,. When I upgraded to an iPhone 6 I was unable to pair the Pulse to the iPhone 6. I contacted the technical support team at Withings and they were able to assist me in re-initializing the Pulse so I could pair the Pulse to my iPhone 6. Withings' support group was outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: elgordoh

customer_reviews.title: A few words on how easy it was to use and very limited directions for ...
customer_reviews.text: I was very unhappy right out of the box because there was next to no documentation. A few words on how easy it was to use and very limited directions for use that forgot to mention charge it first! You have to put the unit into sleep mode. I've had problems getting it into sleep mode most of the 5 Months I used it. I gave up after failing to go into sleep mode for a week or so. I stopped using it a few months ago for about a week then it worked well for a while. There is a reason this company is not the leader in the industry!
customer_reviews.author: Alan Hawley

customer_reviews.title: Don't Expect O2 readings...
customer_reviews.text: Junk, or something close to it. We bought it for my wife with COPD could keep tabs on her O2 levels, but this thing refused to read them and when it rarely did produce a reading, it was way off target. Keep working, Withings. It's there somewhere, but this ain't it.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Jones

customer_reviews.title: Seems pretty accurate. Probably only charge it once every week ...
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for a few months now. Keep it in my bluejeans 5th pocket. I've never used the wrist band. The heartbeat monitor isn't really practical. I've never used the sleep function either. I sync it with my iPhone's Withings app. Then upload the info automatically to Humana Vitality. Seems pretty accurate. Probably only charge it once every week and a half to two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: William Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, it sync's with my iPhone with a touch. Accurately counts my steps and tracks elevation, distance, calories, time and sleep. It has a pulse and pulse Ox feature that is nice, but you have to remove the device from it's holder to measure your pulse and O2 levels. Wish it would work without removing it from the watchband, or the waist belt clip. Make sure you don't wear it into the shower, it doesn't like being wet! I can keep up to date on daily walking and running goals with the push of a button. The iPhone App is great and will link and sync with a number of other fitness and nutrition apps.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Arnett

customer_reviews.title: Great device, one lousy accessory.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful device. Very user friendly and not to complicated to figure out. The battery life is better than I expected, I can go nearly a week without recharging and this is using it while I sleep. My only concern is is the belt clip. It weakens only after a couple of weeks and the device will fall out. I have already lost one Pulse this way and almost gave up on buying another. Luckily I loved the Pulse so much I decided it was worth not using the belt clip anymore unless it is improved. I strongly recommend the Pulse for anyone who needs a silent watchdog for developing an healthier lifestyle.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Baptist

customer_reviews.title: I liked the device it worked well and everything
customer_reviews.text: I liked the device it worked well and everything. However a major flaw in the design of the device is that it does not correctly count the number of steps taken when worn on the wrist. Unfortunately the belt holster they provide does not hold the device securely in place and due to this issue I lost the device weeks after getting it there goes 119.00 dollars done the drain. If I were to repurchase this device I would never again trust the belt holster for it and would put it in my pocket. VERY VERY Disappointed in the design of the holster DO NOT USE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: JAMES ADAMS

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from OFF!
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying that I love this fitness tracker. I'm an active guy that enjoys the outdoors and have enjoyed tracking my progress. The other day, however, I sprayed some OFF bug spray on myself and some got on the Withings. It completely destroyed the face. While the tracker still works, it looks terrible. Keep in mind - this is a tracker I wear on my wrist and have gotten tons of compliments on its looks as a watch. I just wish there was some kind of warning as bug spray is pretty prominently used when hiking or other outdoor activities.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Already malfunctioning
customer_reviews.text: After only about 6 months, the icon (a crescent moon) that one touches to begin sleep monitoring started working only intermittently. Most of the time, I touch it and it ignores me. Oddly, the heart icon for pulse measurement, which is on the same page as the moon icon for sleep measurement, works every time. Sometimes the moon icon will work after I reboot the watch. Sometimes not.
customer_reviews.author: CWS

customer_reviews.title: Can't recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed with this product. Not easy to use. Fitbit was fairly intuitive - not so with this one. Won't recommend it. Husband went back to carrying his android to measure his steps which is even more accurate than these fitness bands.
customer_reviews.author: Spiderlakegirl

customer_reviews.title: decent enough maybe the pulse is fixed by now...not sure
customer_reviews.text: so have a few other pieces from manufacturer and this guy is probably the weakest... the pulse seems to be off when compared to the cuff they have and also against an Omron I have so running the 3 this guy is out there...always seems high but for the other stuff it tracks seems to be fine inline with some of the other hardware I have used in this arena...i have not bothered to call support about the pulse so I guess one could say not giving them a fair shake as far as that goes but I did flash the firmware directly upon receipt due to an error right out of the shoot........
customer_reviews.author: M Thompson

customer_reviews.title: One of the best if not the best tracker at this time....don't wash it!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best trackers there is and I have owned almost every one. Small and I like that you don't have to wear it on your wrist (I like to wear a watch). Great app and the display is fantastic. Sleep tracking is really good and steps and distance more accurate than most. I did a full walking test of this the Garmin, Pulse, Up24 and more and this was the most accurate. Wish I still had it......don't leave it clipped to your shorts and throw them in the wash...it will not withstand a full wash cycle...dang!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery Braun

customer_reviews.title: Lots of information
customer_reviews.text: I love this device. The step tracking seems quite accurate, and the sleep tracking is super helpful. Really great that you can drop it in your pocket, clip it on clothing or wear it on your wrist. What would it have to do to get 5 stars? Recognize when I'm asleep and awake. Currently you need to tell it you're going to bed and getting up. The automated feature for this doesn't work well. Also, the android app works well, but the web portal is nicer - takes a while for that sync to happen.
customer_reviews.author: Catherin Hayt

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: When I received this product it started working sporadically after the first day. I contacted Amazon for an exchange. they sent a new one the next day. It works great. The first one was a fluke because the new one is awesome. It does everything it says it does and is super easy to use. I like that it comes with a clip and the watch accessory so that you can wear it however works best for you. It syncs easily to your phone. Can't say enough good things about it or the way they handled my exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Marisol Smith

customer_reviews.title: I lost 40 pounds with assistance from Withings products
customer_reviews.text: I have had the Withings Pulse O2 for over a year. I use it every day and it is very helpful. I keep it in my pocket during my waking hours and I also wear it on my wrist while I sleep. I use the Pulse in addition to the Withings Blood Pressure Monitor and the Withings Smart Body Analyzer scale. I have lost about 40 pounds since I started to monitor my weight and health with Withings devices. I highly recommend the three Withings products that I use daily. Thank you Withings!
customer_reviews.author: John Galt

customer_reviews.title: Buy the Fit Bit
customer_reviews.text: I generally like Withings products but do not really care for the pulse. It is larger and bulkier than the FitBit to wear as a wristband and the way it inserts in the band and the optional belt clip makes it easy to slip out. I wore it today on my belt and realized near the end of the day that it was gone and my clip was still on my belt. Luckily someone found it in the office floor. It also it difficult to sync up to my pc. I think I am going to buy the FitBit. Withings instructions and FAQ are VERY generic and do not offer enough info to help you.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: How Can This Help You With Health When It Dies After a Week? + Terrible Usability.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device specifically for its heart rate at SPO2. Yet it's the most difficult task to perform with this device. You have to remove tracker, take a reading, then put it back. I don't see how that would make anyone's life easier. Because it's difficult, and does not provide continuous data, it's essentially worthless. Worse yet, mine died a week into using it. Bricked for no apparent reason. Thankfully, Amazon is the world champ at making things right. I returned it and I'm waiting on a different brand now.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin D. Cutshall

customer_reviews.title: Great in you pocket.  Less likely to accidentally go through your laundry as it does not clip to your pants
customer_reviews.text: I had several digital pedometers that clipped to my clothing. I unintentionally discovered that that brand can survive one wash cycle still clipped to my pants. I subsequently discovered that it can not survive a drying cycle. And that product did not have a pulse oximeter. The withings pulse seems quite reliable though I wish it's vertical measurements was in floors, not feet
customer_reviews.author: Red Fox

customer_reviews.title: Wanted this to work!
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be great but it did not track steps correctly or did it do a good gob measuring O2. I did buy it as a used unit from the Amazon Warehouse site and I usually have good results when doing so, probably will purchase from them again depending on what type of item I need. I downloaded the software for this as well as Health Mate - was very upset this didn't work, not sure if I should try another one but will keep an eye out for this type of system.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Briley

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 3 days
customer_reviews.text: Just as I'm getting used to this device and starting my regularly training regime, I go for a run and at the end of the 10 miles I look down and the device fell out of the band. Why would they develop something that so easily falls out of the watch band? I do not understand.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: A bad start but I'm very happy
customer_reviews.text: I researched about 6 or 7 fitness trackers and picked the Withings Pulse. I can only hope my experience was an isolated one but the one sent to me died after one charge and one day of use. I took a chance that it was and requested a replacement. The replacement (Amazon sent it really fast) has been working great for several weeks now. I love it. My only wish is that it was waterproof. Other than that I am really happy its performance. I'm also very happy with the associated app.
customer_reviews.author: Hector

customer_reviews.title: Does not work - sync problem
customer_reviews.text: Does not sync the steps and sleep data to the app. (Strangely, it does sync heart data from the device to the app.) Verified that Bluetooth connection is set up properly. I have spent many, many hours over the past six days on the phone with Withings / Nokia tech support - despite elevating it to their top level of support, they cannot solve the problem. When it didn't work on my iPhone, we even tried setting it up on my iPad - same problem. Will be returning it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: rcoatebelmont

customer_reviews.title: Love this health tracker
customer_reviews.text: Love this health tracker, I started off wearing it on my wrist like a watch but switched to the clip after about a month. It has a great phone app or login to your computer for a bigger picture. It monitors steps, elevation, distance and calories, sleep, O2 and heart rate. You can swipe the device to compare with previous days. My wife has a Fitbit but it has no display and says here next tracker will be a Withings.
customer_reviews.author: bigGdaddy

customer_reviews.title: I rate it at 4.75 - read review.
customer_reviews.text: It works great and does everything I expected it to do plus more. I can count steps walked, stairs climbed, heart rate, calories. The only reason I didn't give it a full '5' star is because you have to remove the device from the band to take your hear rate. Other than that, I can keep track of all activity online or on my smartphone. One think I particularly like is the Congratulations notices of badges I earned. I never expected that and I like the positive reinforcement.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mclain

customer_reviews.title: it is great concept. The distance measurement is extremely accurate and ...
customer_reviews.text: it is great concept. The distance measurement is extremely accurate and I really wanted to use it. However, I replaced it twice and both times it broke. I then for a third one and it works, then goes to sleep and sometimes wakes up. There was absolutely no response from customer service on 2 emails. SO I will go back to the fitbit which seems to work but I would really love to have a working Withings.
customer_reviews.author: travelalot21

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT! Start holding yourself accountable today!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Pulse O2. Tracking your activity keeps you accountable to goals and should push you to perform! It is durable! I've had it about one year now; I wear it everyday, for every workout and while working (as a police officer). It has been through a lot in my Crossfit workouts and while working and there are only a few cosmetic issues on it, and those are from me banking it against stuff when walking around. Get one and get your fitness on!!!
customer_reviews.author: Wrighteous

customer_reviews.title: Withings Nightmare!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the Pulse for over a year and became addicted to it. It is an essential part of my daily workout. Just when it got out of warranty it stopped working, so I ordered the new model 9D O2. It would not even come on after charging in different ways, so I returned for replacement. The button was broke, so I returned. So I ordered two new ones, hoping to beat the odds, and they actually come on but do not attach to blue tooth. Only message is "go.withings.com." Well, I had already gone to Withings several time, and never heard a word. What is going on at Withings??? Can anyone help me get back my workout?
customer_reviews.author: Dennis William Hauck

customer_reviews.title: Like the integration of this with the Withings Scale
customer_reviews.text: I've used othe fitness bands before, but I've settled on this one. Why? The integration of the withings app, the band and the scale. Toss in seamless integration with third party apps like run keeper plus health mate and now I track all my activity, all my calories consumed and burned, and I'm now "managed" into better health. This is a winner......hands down.
customer_reviews.author: DC GuyTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Not water resistant!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Nike+ FuelBand, which died on me after 2 years of use. When I got it, I love it. It had a beautiful design and functioned as a watch as well as an activity tracker. I had it for a day before it broke after I got a bit of water on it while washing my hands. I wanted to love it so bad, but an activity tracker is pretty much useless if it isn't water resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Jess W.

customer_reviews.title: I love this gadget
customer_reviews.text: I love this gadget. It inspires me to take more steps and it lets me monitor my sleep, which I was particularly interested in doing, and roughly how many calories I'm burning. While I realize that it may not always be completely accurate, it seems pretty close to the mark and provides a good gage of whether or not I'm increasing my activity level and by how much. I've lost three pounds in the first few days of wearing it, so I hope I can keep it up!
customer_reviews.author: Judith Kovach

customer_reviews.title: Don't use the belt clip!
customer_reviews.text: Had trouble getting it to sync up, then the app insisted that I carry it everywhere and couldn't just compare the Pulse to the phone app counts and figure out total steps between the two. Was going to return it, but I was carrying it in the included belt clip and it fell out somewhere during a routine trip to the grocery store. Saved me the trouble of returning it, but now I don't get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: dwc

customer_reviews.title: Sale pitch playing with words.
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't impressed with the heart rate feature and O2sat. The sales pitch says it does it. But what it doesn't say is that it's not a full time monitor you have to take the unit off your arm and flame it on your finger when you want to check Ya pulse. Typical sales pitch just to sell the units. I don't use it any more and have thrown it in the back of the cupboard with the rest of the junk I've bought over the years
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: I love how it measures my sleep
customer_reviews.text: It really keeps you motivated to keep moving. I have reached 8200 steps and am still trying to reach 10000 steps daily. I love how it measures my sleep. How long it took me to fall asleep, how many times I got up, how long was light sleep and how long was deep sleep. I don't like the part of taking the electronic device off wrist strap to obtain O2 and heart rate. Should have a hole in back for the eye to see thru.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: to your health
customer_reviews.text: After about a two weeks of research I settled for this one glad I did works well just what I wanted from a smart watch, battery life is long, came with a wrist band and a hook piece for your belt or pocket, along with the other functions it has, it has a elevation mode so I live on the third floor, it actually tells that I took 20 steps going up, isn't that cool, buy this one it's worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: zac60

customer_reviews.title: Withings is significantly better than Jawbone, Fitbit and others!
customer_reviews.text: Love this fitness tracker. It has just about everything I wanted in a tracker. Better than FitBit and Jawbone and others because of the display, the versatility of being either on the wrist or clip or just in your pocket, and the heart rate monitor. So please and delighted. I've lost almost 20lbs in part because of the tracking and accountability of this little gem. I've recommended it to friends and family and two have purchased one over some other brands they were considering. Thanks Withings
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bendick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent activity/sleep/heart tracker
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this product. I tried several other products but this one is the best. It is accurate, easy to use, the app is pretty good. Battery life is long. I really like the belt clip better than a wrist product that doesn't fit well for daytime use. The customer service is outstanding. I contacted them via email because my belt clip had torn and they replaced it at no charge and it arrived quickly - awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Greeneyze

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: If you want something for 6 months OK . They don't last....no wonder it's been discontinued
customer_reviews.author: JimmyM

customer_reviews.title: O2 functionality is disabled in Japan.
customer_reviews.text: O2 functionality is disabled in Japan therefore we I had no reason to pay extra for O2 instead of Pulse. I dropped my first one while I'm running on the bike therefore I bought another one, but the display became to show nothing after a couple of weeks. I love Withings products and I use their products from the first wifi weight scale until recent Steel HR and Thermo, but this product gave the worst (exceptional) experience to me. Health Mate web-site has been asking me to write a review endlessly so I'm writing this, unfortunately, unwillingly.
customer_reviews.author: munehiko OHTA

customer_reviews.title: Good design but very poor software app
customer_reviews.text: The watch is well-designed and lightweight. Battery lasts for almost a week after a complete charge. The major drawback is the software that comes along with it. It does not record the history of all the information collected from the device -- for example, calories burnt during active and passive states. UPDATE: After 3 months of work, the device died most likely due to battery malfunction...
customer_reviews.author: Valderama

customer_reviews.title: Three Units: Three Touch-Screen Malfunctions
customer_reviews.text: I got one for my wife, which works great. She liked it so much that I got myself one. The first one I got started having touch-screen errors after a couple days (e.g., I could not swipe to see older data, I could not initiate the heart rate monitor or sleep mode). Withings customer support said that it was a hardware issue, so I exchanged the unit for a new one. That second unit also started malfunctioning after a few days. I love the Withings iOS and web apps (we use the scale and BP monitor), so, desperate to get a working unit, I exchanged the second unit for yet another one. Same thing. I'm so frustrated!
customer_reviews.author: kooyaa

customer_reviews.title: I like the accessories - watch strap
customer_reviews.text: There is an overdependence on the mobile device to set this thing up. But other than that, it seems okay. I like the accessories - watch strap, belt clip. But I'm not sure how long the belt clip will last since I have to pull at the rubber every night to get it fixed onto the watch band every night. I don't like the rubbery texture on the device. This sort of thing tends to peel after a while. In fact, it is starting to look pretty beat up already.
customer_reviews.author: worddict

customer_reviews.title: My Pulse O2's battery only lasts 4 days between charging ...
customer_reviews.text: My Pulse O2's battery only lasts 4 days between charging. I've contacted Withings customer support. Their response was to do a hard reset then refrain from using the pulse reader, the display and to not force a sync. After doing that it still only lasts 4 days. I've asked if they would replace mine with one that will last the advertised two weeks. I'm waiting for a response.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Withings "customer service" is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I got a returned unit from Warehouse Deals and it has never worked. roughly 2 weeks in i gave up and am returning it to amazon the email support suggests i do what i have already done after getting the issue to a senior agent i did't get a response for 9 days and when i did it was in german and they want the mac address for a unit that won't work... good luck if you need help from withings
customer_reviews.author: Matt Maxon

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, poor practical delivery
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing- compared it alongside a FitBit one (both clipped on a neck lanyard) for a month... (1) the Pulse consistently undercounted daily steps by 12-13% (about 1,200-1,250 steps out of 10,000 steps total), (2) the Pulse was less accurate than the FitBit in tracking sleep characteristics, and was not as easy to use, and (3) after less than 2 weeks of use, the battery in my unit would not hold a charge for more than 24 hours. Stopped using the unit after a month of poor performance and threw it into a storage drawer... ultimately gave it away to someone I didn't like. Definitely would NOT recommend purchasing this product.
customer_reviews.author: pspurlo

customer_reviews.title: and love to clip on clothing
customer_reviews.text: so many options, long lasting battery, used both as a wristwatch, and love to clip on clothing, very secure, as a respiratory therapist love the pulse ox option. Love showing pulse ox to all of my coworkers and docs. No one has seen the pulse ox option. takes a beating I am not gentle on my things, a bit of a clutz, light forget I am wearing even on my wrist, very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Panda

customer_reviews.title: Good sync in with the Withings ecosystem
customer_reviews.text: Does not ever seem to automatically sync. The heartbeat sensor is now always incorrect. My resting heartrate on my Galaxy note is 58, O2 pulse claims its at 137. Good sync in with the Withings ecosystem. They make a dynamite scale. Good pedometer but the advertised features do not function as...well...advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Benyosef

product_meta.title: Withings Pulse O2 Health and Fitness Tracker - Black
product_meta.description:
An advanced activity tracker to monitor your activity (steps, elevation, calories burned & distance), sleep cycles, and read key vital signs: heart-rate and Blood Oxygen Level (SPO2).

LEGAL DISCLAIMER
Used. All sales final. No returns. Buyer beware.

MANUFACTURER'S DESCRIPTION
 


Running the good race. Track your run--just grab your Pulse Ox and go! The tracker recognizes your running: it automatically displays a Run Recap screen with your racing stats. Push the top button once and know where you stand. Easy history browsing with touch screen--with the Pulse Ox, you have easy access to your data. There's no need to have your smartphone to see the history of all of your activities. 


Listen to your heart Monitor your heart rate--health starts with a strong heart. Take regular measures and consider your resting heart rate's history to know if you're improving your overall fitness level. Press your finger on the back of the device, wait a few seconds--ta-da! Your pulse and SpO2 are displayed on the screen. Monitor your SpO2. SpO2, also known as "The Fifth Vital Sign", is an estimation of your blood's oxygen saturation level, measured with a pulse oximeter. Athletes, mountain climbers and people with breathing problems like asthma can benefit from this feature by providing them a rapid assessment and monitoring of hypoxia 


Faithfully following your nights Monitor your sleep--place the Withings Pulse Ox in the wristband and launch the sleep cycle analysis. In the morning, the Pulse Ox automatically detects when you are awake. The in-app graph shows the different sleep cycles and lists key sleep quality indicators in order to help you have more restorative nights. 


Coaching on your phone The Pulse Ox automatically synchronize to track all your progress on your smartphone. Insights and reminders--Health Mate incorporates a timeline with daily reports and contextualised advice to support your efforts. These Withings Insights help you to stay focused and motivated. 


10 days of history on your Pulse Ox Touch screen with access to data for the past 10 days. Makes it possible to see the details of your physical activity without having to look at your smartphone) 



Wear-it-your-way--the Pulse Ox adapts to your style Slap it on your wrist using the adjustable wristband (the Pulse Ox displays the time), attach it to your belt or apparel using the clip, drop it in your pocket or bag and at night, use the wristband to monitor your sleep

About the Startup 
Describe your product in 3 words.

Smart, motivational, easy 

How did you come up with the idea for this product?

We wanted to create the ideal health tracker -- one that would analyze vital signs and be smart enough to adapt to any lifestyle. 

What makes your product special?

A fitness tracker that tracks more than activity, with built-in heart rate and SPO2 functions.

What has been the best part of your startup experience?

Participating to the Connected Health revolution. It means empowering people to take control over their own health and wellness thanks to beautiful devices and apps.



BOX CONTAINS
1 x Activity Tracker

See more
feature_bullets: Three layer fabric stretch panels for additional freedom of movement

specifications.Delivery information:: We cannot deliver certain products outside mainland UK ( ). We will only be able to confirm if this product can be delivered to your chosen address when you enter your delivery address at checkout.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
